}} 'Fatty acid amide hydrolase' (, FAAH, oleamide hydrolase, anandamide
amidohydrolase) is a member of the serine hydrolase family of enzymes. It was
first shown to break down anandamide in 1993. In
humans, it is encoded by the gene FAAH.
categories: Hydrolases acting on nonpeptide C-N bonds
